|Title=Know how to list the main complications of acute pericarditis
|Description= Abundant pericardial effusion, tamponade, myocarditis, recurrent pericarditis, chronic pericarditis, constrictive pericarditis.
|Rubric=Follow-up and/or prognosis
|Contributors=Jennifer Cautela
|Order=13}}


* '''Myocarditis = myo-pericarditis:''''
** elevation of troponin
** diagnosis on cardiac MRI (subepicardial enhancement),
** risk of heart failure and ventricular rhythm disorders

* '''Tamponnade'''
* Recurrence (frequent in benign acute viral pericarditis)
* Pericardial constriction = chronic calcifying pericarditis, progressive evolution towards right heart failure, diagnosed on right catheterisation (dip plateau, equalisation of diastolic pressures).

question.title: What is a potential complication of acute pericarditis?
question.description: A list of possible complications of acute pericarditis

option_a.title: Chronic pericarditis
option_a.description: A long-term condition characterized by inflammation of the pericardium

option_c.title: Constrictive pericarditis
option_c.description: A condition where the pericardium becomes stiff and prevents the heart from expanding

option_d.title: Right heart failure
option_d.description: A condition where the right side of the heart is unable to pump blood effectively

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer option
